author: akagi201
content: Is there any existing eof parse tool to parse EOF bytecodes?

author: _shemnon
content: Besu has a pretty printer in it's main line - https://github.com/hyperledger/besu -- `evmtool prettyprint <bytecode>`

author: _shemnon
content: Here's Besu's PR for `CancunEOFTime` -  https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/7227 - branch is https://github.com/shemnon/besu/tree/eof/cancunEOF-fork

author: draganrakita
content:
In revm it prints both EOF (if it starts with xEF) or legacy if not. 
It is called from revm repo with `cargo run -p revme bytecode 0xEF00123`
